headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, Deprecation, Sunset
headers.vary: Accept, Authorization, Cookie, X-GitHub-OTP, Accept-Encoding, Accept, X-Requested-With
headers.x-github-media-type: github.squirrel-girl-preview; format=json, github.inertia-preview; format=json, github.starfox-preview; format=json, github.mockingbird-preview; param=sailor-v-preview; format=json
headers.x-oauth-scopes: admin:enterprise, admin:gpg_key, admin:org, admin:org_hook, admin:public_key, admin:repo_hook, gist, repo, user, workflow, write:discussion, write:packages

data.title: GitHub Actions for Azure
data.body:
This initiatives drives the following epics:

**GH Enterprise**
- [ ] Action support in GH Enterprise: Track telemetry, docs, App, traceability etc. #415

**Azure Government cloud and Jedi**
- [ ] Support for Azure Government cloud and Jedi #495
- [ ] Azure login Action - Support for MSI auth #40

**Azure ARC**
- [ ] GitHub Action support for K8s deployments to ARC managed clusters #512

**Project Lima**
Project Lima brings Azure Application Platform, Azure Arc, and Azure Kubernetes Services together to create vast new possibilities for deployment and management.Customers can use the ease of the App Platform to deploy wherever they need to, backed by the security, compliance and management capabilities of Azure.
  - Web Apps, Function Apps, Logic Apps, API Management gateways, Event Grid to run on any K8s cluster on Azure or any cloud. 
  - Azure ARM and Azure Policy would continue to work as-is and require no specific changes wrt Actions 
  - Azure Web App create experience will support both Lima and GitHub 
     https://github.com/github/GitHub-EcoSystem/issues/128

- [ ] Project Lima - Actions update #38
- [ ] Project Lima - Templates & Documentation Update #129

**GitHub App for Azure**
- [x] Prototype a seamless Authorization/Authentication experience between GH & Azure #87
- [ ] Listen to events from GitHub in Azure - Webhooks #21 
- [ ] Azure App integration with Azure Policy as code experience #126
- [ ]  Production ready seamless Authorization/Authentication experience between GH & Azure #474
- [ ] Azure App integration with Azure Security Center Integration #376
- [ ] Azure App integration with DevOps starter experiences #199
- [ ] App integration with static web app creation experience #198
- [ ] Azure App integration with App service deployment center & create blade experiences #197
- [ ] Azure App integration with container scanning action/app #195 

**GitHub Actions**
- [x] GitHub Actions for Azure Web App #37
- [x] GitHub Actions for Postgres SQL Database #135
- [ ] GitHub Action support for Azure Stack #23
- [ ] GitHub Actions enhancements for Azure login #134
- [ ] GitHub Actions enhancements for WebApp and Database #387
- [x] GH Actions for Machine Learning #89 
- [x] Integrating Event Grid / GH Triggers with Train Action #42
- [ ] Github to Kubernetes and AKS through actions and gitops #93
- [ ] Define VM VMSS and AKS GitOps strategy for GitHub Actions for Azure #493
`- [ ] Verified actions by azure #123
`
---
    GitHub Actions - Azure Monitor integration #127
    GitHub Action support for ACR #2
    Securing containers #1
    Vulnerability metadata and policies #4
    GitHub Actions for Logic Apps, APIM, Event Grid, IOT #317 

**Telemetry and Documentation**
- [ ] Telemetry analysis: GitHub Actions #319
- [ ] Telemetry analysis: Why AWS has more deployments with less repos #142
- [ ] GitHub Action Telemetry enhancements #136
- [ ] Telemetry: Add telemetry for Action execution through each channel and entry points #447
- [ ] Improve SEO for documentation of GitHub Actions for Azure #207
- [ ] Identifying and improving topic coverage of GitHub Actions for Azure on docs.microsoft.com #208
